meet our team

team

California Psychological Services, Inc. is a comprehensive agency providing an impressive breadth of direct mental health services to a diverse range of clientele within the greater Los Angeles area. We provide individual, couples, family, and group therapy, as well as comprehensive psychological assessments, testing, and consultation services. The cornerstone of our practice constitutes empirically-based approaches, an acknowledgement of the fundamental mind-body connection, and strong ethics rooted in a social justice sensibility.
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Aliquam at metus et metus dignissim rutrum sit amet eget sapien.
Dr. Rashim D’Angelo, PhD
CEO/Licensed Clinical Psychologist
As a Licensed Clinical Psychologist (PSY27365), Rashin D’Angelo, PhD, specializes in addiction, trauma, mood disorders (depression, anxiety, bipolar disorder), and co-occurring disorders. Although her theoretical orientation is largely psychodynamic, emphasizing emotional experience as key to personality functioning, she uses an integrative approach with clients, incorporating Jungian and analytical psychology, cognitive behavior therapy, trauma-informed practices, and mind-body techniques to address the individual needs of each client. Dr. D’Angelo earned her MA in Spiritual Psychology at University of Santa Monica (2009) and completed her PhD in Clinical Psychology with an emphasis in depth psychology at Pacifica Graduate Institute (2013). Read more
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Aliquam at metus et metus dignissim rutrum sit amet eget sapien.
Megan Kain, PsyD
Licensed Psychologist, Clinical Director
Dr. Kain’s current role as a licensed clinical psychologist is a function of her cumulative life experiences. Along the way, she has discovered a professional passion residing in working with various manifestations of systemic trauma; high-need, clinically complex populations that exist at the intersection of legal and mental health issues. After attending the University of Michigan for her undergraduate degree in Psychology, she achieved a Masters and PsyD in Clinical Psychology through Antioch University in Santa Barbara. Read more
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Aliquam at metus et metus dignissim rutrum sit amet eget sapien.
Nicole Penick, PsyD
Lorem Ipsum
Dr. Penick works with children, adolescents, and adult clients in individual and family therapy. Her sincere desire is to establish a safe place where individuals can learn how to overcome their existing limitations with a positive experience and outlook on therapy and being able to reestablish themselves. Dr. Penick has been exposed to a vast array of theories and hypotheses with respect to therapy. However, her core orientation is psychodynamic, with an emphasis on a humanistic mindset. She believes in using an incorporate cognitive behavioral therapy and life span development to tackle the individual desires of each person. She obtained a Masters in Counseling and PsyD in Applied clinical psychology and currently working towards licensure as a clinical psychologist. Read more
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Aliquam at metus et metus dignissim rutrum sit amet eget sapien.
Rosie Grigoryan, AMFT
Lorem Ipsum
Ruzanna works with those who seek support in couples, family, and individual therapy. Ruzanna’s personal philosophy is that you are the author of your own book, unfurled through life’s experiences. Ruzanna firmly believes that an individual’s behavior – no matter how difficult to understand at times - is shaped to protect the mind, body, and soul. In order to “re-author” what was once detrimental to the story, one must make the conscious and courageous step to unlearn and redesign a new storyline, to build positive change and have a fulfilling outcome. Read more
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Aliquam at metus et metus dignissim rutrum sit amet eget sapien.
Wendy Campos, LCSW
Lorem Ipsum
Wendy is a Licensed Clinical Social Worker with 8.5 years of experience and has worked with children, adolescents, adults, families, and couples. Wendy is fluent in English and Spanish and prides herself on promoting cultural humility. Wendy aims to provide a safe space free of judgment and foster a collaborative therapeutic relationship. Her experience includes treating anxiety, depression, PTSD, grief, marital struggles, and parenting. Wendy received her Master of Social Work from the University of Southern California and is currently pursuing a Doctorate in Clinical Psychology from The Chicago School of Professional Psychology. Read more
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Aliquam at metus et metus dignissim rutrum sit amet eget sapien.
Allison Wolf, LMFT
Licensed Therapist
Allison Wolf is a Licensed Marriage and Family Therapist with a passion for working with individuals, couples, and families. Allison specializes in treating depression, anxiety, substance abuse issues, co-occurring disorders, and trauma. Utilizing a psychodynamic and integrative approach, Allison assists individuals in regulating and managing their emotions while developing adaptive coping strategies. She is especially interested in helping others heal core conflicts and internal struggles. Allison offers non-judgmental compassion and encouragement to support others in being their true selves. Read more
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Aliquam at metus et metus dignissim rutrum sit amet eget sapien.
Laura Escobar, LCSW
Lorem Ipsum
A native Angelino, Laura received her Bachelor’s in Social Work from CSU Los Angeles and her master’s in Social Work from CSU Long Beach. She works in English and Spanish and has experience working in an inpatient psychiatric setting as well as community mental health. She believes that healing emerges through intentional everyday practices that transform into rituals of self-care. Using an intersectional, anti-oppression, and strength-based framework, Laura approaches therapy as a collaborative process to navigate the complexities of individual lived experience and interpersonal relationships. As a therapist she supports and identifies the strengths and internal resources clients are inherently born with and promotes the connection to self and community. Laura strives to create a warm and empathetic environment to promote self-expression and connect unconscious behaviors and the impact those behaviors have on the present. Read more
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Aliquam at metus et metus dignissim rutrum sit amet eget sapien.
Cynthia Lemus, ACSW
Psychological Assistant
Cynthia Lemus is a bilingual speaking therapist, fluent in English and Spanish. She attained her Bachelor's degree in Child Development and Masters of Social Work from CSUN (California State University, Northridge). As a doctoral level psychological assistant, she is currently completing her last year of PsyD studies in Applied Clinical Psychology at The Chicago School of Professional Psychology. Cynthia has four years of experience as an outpatient mental health therapist and certified in various evidence-based practices such as, MAP (Managing and Adapting Practices), TF-CBT (Trauma-Focused Cognitive Behavioral Therapy), and CPP (Child-Parent Psychotherapy). Read more
Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Aliquam at metus et metus dignissim rutrum sit amet eget sapien.
Amon Benavides, LMFT
Lorem Ipsum
Amon has experience working with clients in a residential drug treatment facility, as well as in school-based and private practice settings. Previously, Amon’s focus was on applied behavioral analysis (ABA). His experience includes work as a behavioral interventionist, where he planned and implemented behavioral interventions. Amon eventually became a behavioral supervisor, where he hired and trained his own behavioral staff and implemented behavioral plans for multiple cases. Amon’s pursuit of ABA led him to work as a behavioral care manager for CenCal Health. As an ABA manager, he oversaw multiple ABA cases, where he authorized behavioral services based on psychological evaluations from multiple behavioral care agencies. Read more
